content:
TITLE: Initializing DataStore in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how DataStore is initialized by calling the initSchema function. It's a crucial part of the DataStore startup process, where the schema is consumed and the IndexedDB store is created.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/datastore-lifecycle-events.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
DataStore.start()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Migrating from Default Exports to Named Exports in Amplify 5.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to convert default import statements to named imports across various Amplify packages. This change affects all Amplify packages in version 5.x.x, requiring developers to update their import statements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- import Amplify from 'aws-amplify';
+ import { Amplify } from 'aws-amplify'

- import Analytics from '@aws-amplify/analytics';
+ import { Analytics } from '@aws-amplify/analytics';
// or better
+ import { Analytics } from 'aws-amplify';

- import Storage from '@aws-amplify/storage';
+ import { Storage } from '@aws-amplify/storage';
// or better
+ import { Storage } from 'aws-amplify';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Visualizing DataStore API and Storage Engine Interaction using Mermaid
DESCRIPTION: This diagram illustrates how the DataStore API interacts with the Storage Engine, Adapter, Local DB, and Sync Engine. It shows the flow of data and observations between these components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
flowchart TD
  %% API and Storage
  api[[DS API]]-- observe -->storage{Storage Engine}
  storage-- next -->adapter[[Adapter]]
  adapter-->db[[Local DB]]
  db-->api
  sync[[Sync Engine*]]-.-storage
  sync-.-appSync[(AppSync)]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating DataStore Predicate Syntax for Amplify 5.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the changes to DataStore predicate syntax affecting DataStore.query, DataStore.save, DataStore.delete, and DataStore.observe interfaces. The new syntax requires dot notation for comparisons instead of function calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- await DataStore.delete(Post, (post) => post.status('eq', PostStatus.INACTIVE));
+ await DataStore.delete(Post, (post) => post.status.eq(PostStatus.INACTIVE));

- await DataStore.query(Post, p => p.and( p => [p.title('eq', 'Amplify Getting Started Guide'), p.score('gt', 8)]));
+ await DataStore.query(Post, p => p.and( p => [p.title.eq('Amplify Getting Started Guide'), p.score.gt(8)]));
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Merging Subscription Records in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows where the Sync Engine uses the Merger class to merge subscription records with the outbox. It's triggered by a mutation response after the client receives a network response for their generated mutation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/sync-engine.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/src/sync/index.ts#L289
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling DEBUG Logging in JavaScript for AWS Amplify DataStore
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to enable DEBUG level logging for the ConsoleLogger in an AWS Amplify project. This is useful for inspecting DataStore operations and events during development and debugging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/getting-started.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
ConsoleLogger.LOG_LEVEL = "DEBUG";
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Merging AppSync Subscription Events in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates another use of the Merger class in the Sync Engine. It's triggered by an AppSync real-time subscription event, which notifies all clients of a change, including the mutation author.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/sync-engine.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/src/sync/index.ts#L326
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding SSR Support with withSSRContext
DESCRIPTION: Feature that adds server-side rendering support through withSSRContext. This enhancement enables AWS Amplify to be used in server-side rendered applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/aws-amplify/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Features

- **SSR:** withSSRContext ([#6146](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/6146)) ([1cb1afd](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/commit/1cb1afd1e56135908dceb2ef6403f0b3e78067fe))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Subscribing to DataStore Connectivity in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This code shows how DataStore subscribes to connectivity status updates. It's crucial for managing the sync process based on network availability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/datastore-lifecycle-events.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
this.datastoreConnectivity.status().subscribe
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Instantiating Sync Engine in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how the Sync Engine is instantiated in DataStore. It's only created if there's a GraphQL endpoint, otherwise DataStore operates in local-only mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/datastore-lifecycle-events.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
this.sync = new SyncEngine(
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Schema Version Check Structure in JSON
DESCRIPTION: An example structure for storing the schema version in the local database. This object includes an ID, a key 'schemaVersion', and a hash value representing the current schema state. It illustrates how the schema version is managed locally in conjunction with DataStore operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/schema-changes.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{\n    id: \"01FYABF3DMBZZJ46W1CC214NH2\"\n    key: \"schemaVersion\"\n    value: \"\\\"4401034582a70c60713e1f7f9da3b752\\\"\"\n}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up IndexedDB Adapter in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This code reference points to the setUp method in the IndexedDBAdapter, which is responsible for initializing the local database and establishing relations during the DataStore startup process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/datastore-lifecycle-events.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
packages/datastore/src/storage/adapter/IndexedDBAdapter.ts#L82
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: User Model Record Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of a user_[Model Name] table entry representing an actual user-defined model record. This shows the structure of stored model instances including metadata fields for versioning and synchronization tracking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/namespaces.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
	createdAt: "2022-03-16T21:52:07.718Z"
	description: null
	id: "6f69055b-b081-4225-8fc4-1d6d52732660"
	name: "name 1647467527489"
	updatedAt: "2022-03-16T21:52:07.718Z"
	_deleted: null
	_lastChangedAt: 1647467527754
	_version: 1
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Storage.put with Resumable Uploads for Amplify 5.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates changes to the Storage.put API with resumable uploads enabled. The key no longer includes the bucket name, simplifying the callback handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- let uploadedObjectKey;
- Storage.put(file.name, file, {
-   resumable: true,
-   // Necessary to parse the bucket name out to work with the key
-   completeCallback: (obj) => uploadedObjectKey = obj.key.substring( obj.key.indexOf("/") + 1 )
- }

+ let uploadedObjectKey;
+ Storage.put(file.name, file, {
+   resumable: true,
+   completeCallback: (obj) => uploadedObjectKey = obj.key
+ }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sync Model Metadata Table Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of a sync_ModelMetadata table entry used by the Sync Engine. This table stores synchronization metadata including timestamps of the last sync operation and sync intervals for a specific model.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/namespaces.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
	fullSyncInterval: 86400000
	id: "01FYABF3DMBZZJ46W1CC214NH3"
	lastFullSync: 1647467532307
	lastSync: 1647467532307
	lastSyncPredicate: null
	model: "Todo"
	namespace: "user"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and Linking Amplify JS Package Locally
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides commands to initially build and link the Amplify JS package, utilizing Yarn as the package manager. It requires Yarn to be installed and presumes the developer has access to the appropriate IDE environment (e.g., VS Code). The commands prepare the project for local development and testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/contributing.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn && yarn build && yarn link-all && yarn build:watch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Analytics.record API for Amplify 5.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Shows the change to Analytics.record API which no longer accepts string input. Events must now be passed as objects with a name property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- Analytics.record('my example event');
+ Analytics.record({ name: 'my example event' });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Version Update with Server-Side Auth Feature
DESCRIPTION: Support added for server-side authentication flows with Cognito managed login, including various issue fixes and enhancements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/api/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Features

- support server-side auth flows with Cognito managed login ([#14168](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/14168)) ([825d338](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/commit/825d338021964a48ffab07d7b5961c5afa63a50e)), closes [#13788](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/13788) [#13801](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/13801) [#13827](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/13827)
```

```

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Features

- **@aws-amplify/datastore:** Make DataStore available in aws-amplifyâ€¦ ([#5202](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/5202)) ([c9c020d](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/commit/c9c020d6d13c5678ce15c738f7eaebec39e2b48a))
```

TITLE: Adding CloudWatch Logging to AWS Amplify Core
DESCRIPTION: Feature addition that implements CloudWatch logging functionality in the AWS Amplify core package, as referenced in issue #8588.

f370b33

TITLE: Error Handling for AsyncStorage Sync Failures
DESCRIPTION: Bug fix in version 1.2.7-unstable.2 that ensures errors are thrown when synchronization of items from AsyncStorage into Memory fails.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/auth/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Bug Fixes

- **@aws-amplify/auth:** throw error when failed to sync items from AsyncStorage into Memory ([85c3f32](https://github.com/aws/aws-amplify/commit/85c3f32))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring AWS Amplify Storage Default Level (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates configuring the AWS Amplify Storage module, either through the main `Amplify.configure(...)` method or the specific `Storage.configure(...)` method. A related bug fix (#3222) addressed an issue where re-configuring would incorrectly reset the default access level to `private`; the fix ensures it defaults to `public` unless explicitly set otherwise, for example, `Storage.configure({ level: 'protected' })`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/storage/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
Amplify.configure(...)
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
Storage.configure(...)
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
Storage.configure({ level: 'protected' })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling error condition in currentUserPoolUser method
DESCRIPTION: Bug fix that modifies the currentUserPoolUser method to only throw errors when a user is disabled or deleted, improving error handling in the authentication flow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/auth/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
for currentUserPoolUser, only throws error when the user is disabled or deleted
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Migrating Storage.list API for Amplify 5.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Shows changes to the Storage.list API where the 'maxKeys' parameter has been renamed to 'pageSize' and the return type has been modified to include results in a nested property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- const photos = await Storage.list('photos/', { maxKeys: 100 });
- const { key } = photos[0];

+ const photos = await Storage.list('photos/', { pageSize: 100 });
+ const { key } = photos.results[0];
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enhancement: Auth Storage Operations
DESCRIPTION: Added try-catch caching for auth storage operations to improve reliability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/auth/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: commit
CODE:
```
96c100e

TITLE: Starting Sync Engine in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how the Sync Engine is started in DataStore. It sets up subscriptions and handles various sync operations.

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
syncSubscription = this.sync.start(
```

TITLE: Exporting AnalyticsProvider in aws-amplify

TITLE: Visualizing Sync Engine Interactions with Storage and AppSync using Mermaid
DESCRIPTION: This complex diagram shows how the Sync Engine observes changes in Storage and AppSync. It details the interactions between various components of the Sync Engine, including processors, outbox, and merger.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
flowchart TD

  subgraph SyncEngine
  index{index.ts}-- observe -->reach[Core reachability]

  subgraph processors
  mp[Mutation Processor]
  sp[Subscription Processor]
  syp[Sync Processor]
  end

  reach--next-->mp[Mutation Processor]
  reach--next-->sp[Subscription Processor]
  reach--next-->syp[Sync Processor]

  subgraph outbox / merger
  outbox[Outbox]
  merger[Merger]
  outbox---merger
  end

  end

  api[DS API]-.->storage
  mp-- 1. observe -->storage{Storage Engine}
  storage-- 2. next -->merger[merger*]-- next -->storage


  sp-- observe -->appsync[(AppSync)]
  appsync-- next -->sp

  syp---appsync

  mp-->outbox[outbox**]

  appsync<--->outbox
  %% styling
  classDef syncEngineClass fill:#8FB,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px,color:#333;
  class index,mp,sp,syp,merger,outbox syncEngineClass;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fixing AWS-SDK Version Lock in Amplify Core

SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
fix("@aws-amplify/core"): fix aws-sdk version to 2.329.0
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/aws-amplify/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

```
### Bug Fixes

- **aws-amplify:** add DataStore export ([#5421](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/5421)) ([7cab470](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/commit/7cab47085520534327f30b531d3fb0400cc07dac))
```

TITLE: LocalStorage Loading Method Optimization
DESCRIPTION: Bug fix that improves how localStorage is loaded by using existing methods instead of implementing new ones.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
fix("@aws-amplify/core"): use existing methods to load localStorage
```

TITLE: Checking window object existence in AWS Amplify Auth
DESCRIPTION: Bug fix implementation that checks if the window object exists for browser usage, ensuring the auth module works correctly in different JavaScript environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/auth/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
check if window object exists for browser usage
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rebuilding Amplify JS on Subsequent Builds
DESCRIPTION: This snippet includes commands to clean, build, and link the Amplify JS project again if initial setups fail. It is a part of troubleshooting to ensure the fresh state of dependencies and links for continued development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/contributing.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
yarn clean && yarn build && yarn link-all && yarn build:watch
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Hub Event Processing Optimization
DESCRIPTION: Bug fix that removes unneeded Hub.dispatch and Hub.listen calls to improve performance and fix issue #2623.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/core/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
fix("core"): Remove unneeded Hub.dispatch and Hub.listen
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Watch Mode for Builds
DESCRIPTION: Feature that enables watch mode for builds, allowing for faster development by automatically rebuilding when source files change.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/aws-amplify/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Features

- enable watch mode for builds ([#4358](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/issues/4358)) ([055e530](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/commit/055e5308efc308ae6beee78f8963bb2f812e1f85))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exporting DataStore Types from aws-amplify
DESCRIPTION: Bug fix that exports SortDirection and syncExpression types from the main aws-amplify package to improve TypeScript type support for DataStore, as referenced in issue #7104.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/aws-amplify/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: JavaScript

TITLE: Installing Required Dependencies for React Native in Amplify 4.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Shows the commands to install required React Native community dependencies (netinfo and async-storage) when using Amplify 4.x.x with React Native or Expo.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// React Native
yarn add aws-amplify amazon-cognito-identity-js @react-native-community/netinfo @react-native-async-storage/async-storage
npx pod-install

// Expo
yarn add aws-amplify @react-native-community/netinfo @react-native-async-storage/async-storage
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
rm -rf node_modules && yarn && yarn link aws-amplify && yarn link @aws-amplify/datastore && yarn start
```

TITLE: Migrating from Amplify.Auth Pattern to Named Exports for Amplify 5.x.x
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the change from using Amplify.Auth, Amplify.Cache, and Amplify.ServiceWorker to using the corresponding named exports directly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- import { Amplify } from 'aws-amplify';
- Amplify.configure(...);
- // ...
- Amplify.Auth.signIn(...);

+ import { Amplify, Auth } from 'aws-amplify';
+ Amplify.configure(...);
+ // ...
+ Auth.signIn(...);
```

TITLE: DataStore Setting Table Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of a datastore_Setting table entry used for schema versioning. This table stores information about the current schema version of the DataStore.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js/blob/main/packages/datastore/docs/namespaces.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
	id: "01FYABF3DMBZZJ46W1CC214NH2"
	key: "schemaVersion"
	value: "\"4401034582a70c60713e1f7f9da3b752\""
}
```
